I've been looking forward to seeing this film ever since I first caught the trailer, and I'm so glad now that I have. It's truly a cinematic experience in every way - directed by Wim Wenders, with German writer/director/co-writer Pina Bausch choreographing "the dances of life".
On display is her passionate dedication to reproducing the art of dance on film. This glitterous celebration is one as bold as it is beautiful.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The movie centers around when he had just left Waseda University at the tender age of nineteen years old. He ultimately went bankrupt, and twenty years from now made his lifelong dream come true after publishing a book which strongly influenced many poets since then.
